alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 6:09AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Garvin, east central Grady, southeastern Cleveland, southwestern Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 609 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Middleberg to 5 miles southwest of Stratford. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Norman, Newcastle, Blanchard, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lexington, Goldsby, Maysville, Dibble, Wayne, Washington, Paoli, Cole, Wanette, Byars, Rosedale, Criner and Middleberg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 70 and 108. Interstate 44 between mile markers 97 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
